Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Wine Country Stay”
Reviews.Author: carocab
Reviews.Content: La Residence is located right off Rt 29, north of Napa, which is a great location to tour Napa, Yountville, St. Helena, Rutherford, and the southern Silverado Trail. We had two couples that stayed for a weekend trip and we all loved this place. It's like a B & B with 30+ rooms. Although it's kind of between a neighborhood and vineyards, when you enter the property, it has all the character and charm you'd want in Wine Country. There is a historic home from the 1800's with large, comfortable rooms. They've also added shingled outbuildings that have larger suites with patios/balconies. Our room in the historic house was clean and comfortable with access to the front porch balcony. The bathroom was large with great water pressure and Molten Brown amenities. Our friends were in an outbuilding that was very private with their own patio with a pergola and great furniture. There is a hot tub and pool (we didn't use them) and it's all beautifully landscaped with comfortable furniture. There is no restaurant on site, but they have a very good continental breakfast in the morning and a wine and cheese offering in the evening. You can enjoy these on the relaxing and lovely deck. Right next to La Residence is Bistro Don Giovanni, SOOOOO good. We made reservations for 7pm, went to the wine and cheese event at the hotel and then hopped over to the restaurant for dinner - a perfect way to end the day! Some people have commented on the highway noise. It is right off the highway and yes, you can hear some noise. I am usually very sensitive to noise (we always sleep with a fan running!) but wasn't bothered by it at all. Our room was closest to the road, too. We were gone throughout the day and at night, the traffic dies down so we really did not have a problem. The property is so relaxing and comfortable, we just didn't notice it. Also, this is not a chain hotel. It's got some personality. Each room is a little different and unique, so if you are looking for the generic luxury hotel experience, this is probably not for your. If, however, you want a relaxing, beautiful, convenient, comfortable, clean and unique wine country experience, you'll LOVE La Residence.

Reviews.Title: “Great personalized service”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at La Residence for my mom's 70th birthday. The three rooms we had were welcoming and quiet. The beds are SO comfortable. The evening happy hour with great cheeses and wines was outstanding while sitting on the lovely deck and enjoying the fragrance of the grape vines on the property. The manager, Graham, was very friendly and talked with us on the deck our first evening there. He provided great information and history on Napa and some of the establishments. But the crowning definition of great service came when we discovered upon our arrival home that my mother did not have one of her gifts. I called back that night and the lady who answered was most helpful. It had not been located in the room by housekeeping so one of the staff members went to search in the dumpster and lo and behold, it was found among the discarded gift wrapping. Now that is what i call going above and beyond great service and it was all done with a genuinely helpful and friendly attitude. We love Napa and will definitely be staying at La Residence again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Tammy N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel three times and it has been fabulous every time. We love to stay in room 31. It is like staying in a private condo, it is a building all to itself. Their is a hot tub within close proximity to this room that is a real nice treat in the evening after a long day of touring wineries. The grounds at the hotel are very inviting and the outdoor patio off the dining room is especially nice. The hotel provides a very generous continential breakfast in a great dining room, as well as a wonderful happy hour each evening where you can try many different wines which are paired with great hors d'oeuvres. They also serve Hall wine, which is extremely good! The staff is amazing at this great boutique hotel. They always go above and beyond to make your stay the best it can be! You simply cannot go wrong with a stay at La Residence!

Reviews.Title: “Great odgings in Napa”
Reviews.Author: R_V_travel_11
Reviews.Content: Had a great one night stay. High standards of cleanliness and high quality linens and towels. Loved the property and different buildings. Staff great - helped get us a reservation at Don Giovanni. A nice 5-minute walk after a day of driving. Had room 39 on a top floor. If you have large luggage make sure you can carry it up! Recommend a room with a balcony or terrace if you are staying many nights. They are great for evenings savoring the local wines gathered during the day and enjoying the relaxed ambiance. Nice evening wine tasting and a good continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: boymom2
Reviews.Content: What a great stay. Beautiful grounds, quiet property. Breakfast was good and the staff was very helpful. Room was clean and spacious. I appreciated being able to do a one night stay. Being able to walk to Bistro Don Giovanni was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, private, romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_Los_Altos_CA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had avery nice 3-night stay here. We got the larger King room, which I recommend, as it has a table and chairs out on a porch overlooking a little on-property vineyard (like 12 rows of vines). It is well located, at the northern most tip or Napa town, which feels more secluded (even though right on hwy 29). It's only 10 mins into Yountville, and about 20 to St Helena. La Residence is owner by Hall Winery.They do very nice wine tasting each night from 6-7PM, and they'll pour as long as you want to drink. They have a nice assortment of cheeses, and it is a really well done. Breakfast is cereals, breads/pastries, fruit, yogurt and oatmeal. the woman who servicesthe breakfast buffet is very sweet and attentive. a guest asked her to re-heat her tea, and the woman said "can I just make you a fresh cup of tea?"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place in Napa”
Reviews.Author: SdR08
Reviews.Content: We have checked into room 20 at La Residence. Great little place to stay, great large room with a very large bathroom. Room 20 is upstairs from the main building, right at the stairs landing. We have enjoyed the room and the area. Our stay is Monday to Wednesday and it is not full at all, it feels very cozy. Breakfast is included, pastries, coffee and a variety of juices. They do not have a restaurant, but there is a great Italian restaurant within walking distance, Bistro San Giovani, excellent! This is a great place to stay when you want to drive around Napa. We really have enjoyed our stay, and the staff is very good and friendly. Great stay at La Residence. Clean and well taken care off grounds.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Rachel L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Residence Saturday night for our weekend in Napa. We stayed in room 20 (upstairs in the main house) which was very large and had a great bathroom! The price was about average for the area, I mainly chose it because they have a 1 night minimum which is kind of rare in Napa. Here are some things that I really liked about the hotel: - Our room, obviously - The wine and cheese reception held from 6-7 is a nice touch. They serve Hall wine and have a really good selection of cheese - Although it was raining and we didn't use it, the hot tub looked amazing Here are some things that I think could use improvement: - I didn't think the staff were very friendly, particularly the woman at breakfast - The lighting on the property at night needs improvement. We nearly fell going both up and down the stairs in complete darkness, and the road was barely visible driving to/from the parking lot. - Breakfast was just ok. The usual Costco pastries, cereal, and yogurt. I would definitely stay here again for the room, now knowing not to expect the personal touch of a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “La Residence is an excellent property.”
Reviews.Author: JudyDD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just recently celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary in Napa. Our stay at La Residence was ideal. Our Cottage King room was spacious and very clean. The staff was awesome~customer service at its best. The wine and cheese in the evening was really nice and the breakfast, even nicer. We dined at Angele's in downtown Napa which was a recommendation by staff member Kimberlly. Loved it!!!!!! We are truly looking forward to returning to La Residence in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pluses, some minuses”
Reviews.Author: pmow
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on a "visit Napa in the Cabernet season" promotion, end of February, 2012. Pluses first -- everyone working at La Residence is extremely nice and helpful; Molton Brown amenities, very nice; lovely breakfast room and breakfast offerings; and can't complain about a wine and cheese hour in the late afternoon. The overall "look" of the property is nice too. Now for the minuses -- there is highway noise, and I mean relentless highway noise from Hwy. 29 which passes extremely close to the property, high use and high speed limit. I am rather surprised that other reviewers failed to mention it, and I realize that maybe we are more bothered by this type of intrusion. We were using Ambien and earplugs! You have been warned! Upon complaining of this after the first night, we were moved to a larger room at the back of La Residence and that was quite a bit quieter. My other minus is the quality of the bedding -- the pillows are large and hard and extremely uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jjaylh
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly, and helpful. The breakfast should not be called continental because it was very extensive. Boiled eggs, cereals, delicious oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, english muffins, danishs and much more. The wine and cheese in the evening was phenomenal! Met nice people and sampled fantastic wines and cheeses. Can't wait for my next stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Vix509
Reviews.Content: The service was cheerful and friendly. They put on a good breakfast, and a complimentary cheese and wine gathering in the evening. Our room had a fireplace and wonderful linens. It was very comfortable. It is kept immaculately, and it is in a great location for exploring the wine countrly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Cute! Includes wonderful breakfast AND evening cheese & wine!”
Reviews.Author: AudBrightnCheery17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few weeks ago and were pleasantly surprised! I'd like to take credit for finding this place but a friend of ours actually suggested it. (He recommends it to all of his visitors.) :) First off, thank you for being so clean! I am a germaphobe and usually find myself tip toeing around everything but had no problem in our room or anywhere on the property for that matter. Secondly, the staff was so friendly! From the phone call when I placed my reservations, to the nice gentleman who checked us in (so sorry I forgot his name!), to the nice lady who greeted us at breakfast, and even to the nice email I came home to! They even arranged a last minute massage therapist to come in.(So nice by the way! i HIGHLY recommend it. They come to you!) They provide a complimentary breakfast in the morning, my husbands favorite was the oatmeal and cranberries, and also provide wine and cheese in the evening. This really is such a great value and a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Christy N
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago and I must say it was one of the most serene get-a-ways we've had in quite sometime. Our room was cozy and full of antiques, and the bed was amazing. Best night of sleep I've had in a longtime. I loved that the hot tub is open year round, as most places close theirs down in the winter. The staff are all warm and welcoming and were always attentive. The breakfast they serve in the mornings was scrumptious and I'd give the coffee and hot oatmeal 5 stars! We didn't attend the evening wine and cheese hour as we arrived late, but I would have to say our overall experience with La Residence and their staff was definitely 5 Stars! We will be returning guests for sure ... Maybe even make it our anniversary destination. I did see that they have wedding packages so that might be in the cards in the future too!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Elliot F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend the weekend in Napa and wanted a quiet and peaceful B&B for some R&R. Tis was the first time we stayed at the La Residence and will not be the last. We booked the cottage suite which had a separate living room where we could relax after a day of wine tasting. The grounds were beautiful and the complimentary breakfast and evening wine tasting was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Randy
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. Great rooms, location, breakfast, and afternoon wine and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Cute get away.”
Reviews.Author: BTraynor
Reviews.Content: We booked La Residence last minute online. Although we were a bit surprise at the location (out of Napa town and close to the highway), it was a great place to stay. Our room, although a bit old fashioned, was large, clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and very helpful, helping us to organise a tour of the wine region at the very last minute. The evening wine and cheese hour was excellent. A great way to taste local wines and mingle with some of the guests. The breakfast is also excellent, fresh with lots of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not in walk able location.”
Reviews.Author: chickenfriedhummus
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in. And I was disappointed to be away from a walk able area. Location is right off the main road and area is a little shabby. If this hotel was in a better location I would come again. Also the photos on tripadvisor make the grounds look a lot more elegant than reality. It is nice but it as nice than photos lead you to believe. Staff. Very friendly. Breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Eryka12
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay. It was our first trip staying in Napa and we came across La Residence via Travelzoo. We hoped for the best, and we were not disappointed. The location s great, very close to most of the wineries, we did have a driver, but we didn't spend too much time traveling from the hotel to the wineries. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and very spacious, they have a Hall Wine hour from 6-7 on top of everything else. They also had a nice little buffet breakfast that was included (nothing special, but did the job). This stay surpassed all of our expectations and we can't wait to stay here again. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: La Residence was large enough to take care of our needs, and small enough that you built a relationship with the staff while you were there. The room was great, the location was wonderful for running through the vineyards in the morning to try and burn off the calories you accumulate while touring the wineries, and the 5:00 happy hour was a great way to congregate with our friends and other guests before heading out for a wonderful dinner. I have recommended this hotel to other friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: orchidnoir7
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip to La Residence based on reviews from friends of mine who had stayed there. They ranted and raved about the property and the chef. I searched and searched for a B&B in Napa, and I finally came down to 3 choices, and the breakfast was going to be the deciding factor. Because of the things I had heard from my friends, and the website, I chose La Residence. It is a very beautiful B&B. The location is right off of the highway, which is nice, and it is north of town which makes it a bit faster to get to the wineries. However, this also puts it in a location away from EVERYTHING else in downtown Napa. The room was beautiful and comfortable. The shower was a bit tight..and I'm a very small person. Imagine my surprise when we went down for breakfast after staying our first night and there was no chef. Just fruit salad, some pre-packaged danishes, and hard boiled eggs. We asked about the breakfast and they told us the chef had left 2 months prior...after my booking. We were never told this. I cried and cried. I felt like the trip was ruined and I was furious. The whole reason I chose La Residence was for the breakfast, and the only breakfast they had was something I could buy at 7-11 for $1.50. How can they charge the same price per night with no breakfast?? We expressed our disappointment, but they said the manager was out and offered us a free bottle of wine. A nice gesture, but it hardly makes up for it. It was a beautiful B&B...but there is no breakfast along with the bed,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area, great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Tntribefan
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here while in the San Francisco area, wish we had stayed longer! Great location for the wine country, excellent rooms and great service

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, elegant & cozy”
Reviews.Author: SashaTozzi
Reviews.Content: La residence is located in the middle of wine country and in very close distance to numerous excellent wineries and restaurants. The room is large ad cozy with a romantic fireplace always ready to be fired up. Wine tastings at 6 pm are a perfect touch that well complement the nice breakfasts in the morning. Staff is kind and helpful. I highly recommend this inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful landscaping and very unique!”
Reviews.Author: From_Dallas2
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days here recently and were impressed overall. This place is truly unique with it's older buildings and beautiful landscaping and sits among some grape fields. Certainly not one of your cookie cutter chain hotels which is exactly why we chose it. The leaves were just beginning to change and the place was very pretty overall. While the grounds may be 4 star, unfortunately, the place overall is not. Don't get me wrong, it's nice, I just can't give it 4 stars based on the landscaping. The room itself was about a three. It was a large room but we had purchased a higher end room so that was to be expected. We had a semi private balcony that was pleasant in the afternoons. The bed and sheets were good quality, but the little things were a bit off. The nightstand, tables, and cabinets were pretty cheap overall and many of the drawers had good sized gaps where the bottoms did not completely fit the drawer -- making them mostly useless for their purpose. Furnishings were a bit sparse also given how large the room was. The bathroom bathtub was a unique mosaic tile tub unlike anything I'd experienced before, but it had cracks in the grout that needed work. Same thing on the crown molding ... cracks everywhere. I understand we're in California and with the earthquakes I don't expect it to be perfect, but there were just a lot of these little things. We did sample the DVD collection while there and it was a nice distraction to have. Don't expect a top tier selection though as most of the movies were pretty old, but they didn't charge anything to use them so you get what you pay for. The biggest negative overall was the physical location however. You are right along the highway that is the main drag north through town. Traffic noises wafted to your ear pretty much all day and night. They do have a couple of fountains that when running help create some white noise to minimize this, but it still wasn't quite enough. In addition, the fountains were turned off at night so when it should have been the most peaceful, the street noise was even worse. Overall, we did like this place and again it was definitely a nicer experience than a cookie cutter place, but 3 stars is really the most we can give it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Vicki K
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a much more upscale room. The bed and pillows were comfortable but the room was a little dowdy and the bathroom was in need of help. The shower was so small you couldn't turn around and it wouldn't drain. I definely would choose another location next time.

Reviews.Title: “So so, would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Maurizio_and_Jill
Reviews.Content: Despite the reviews, we were frankly disappointed by La Residence, and would not stay here again. We stayed in room 31, which is a very private room with its own entrance nearby the hot tub. The room showed fairly well, but here are the key problems: 1) The bed was a small queen and extremely uncomfortable, soft and unsupportive, and the frame creaked with every toss and turn; 2) The spot behind the head of the bed was very dirty, it was hard to reach but visible, as the bed was oddly angled. That was a bit of a turnoff; 3) the thermostat was a programmable one, but very hard to understand and use, and we could never get the temperature in the room quite right, and ended up waking up to a rather cold room. The room had a fireplace, but no logs to burn, and thus a bit of a waste. Finally, a continental breakfast was included, but it was of average selection and quality, and nothing to write home about. In all, not a horrible stay, but not one that justified the price either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend in the Wine Country!”
Reviews.Author: Randy G
Reviews.Content: This is the first review we have ever written for a hotel or inn....or even a travel website of any kind but we could not resist telling everyone about the terrific long weekend we had last weekend at the La Residence Country Inn in the wine country. First....we noticed the grounds were absolutely beautiful.....the check in was simply deligthful and our room was just wonderful. We had a large, beautifully appointed room on the ground floor with french doors overlooking one of the many outdoor seating areas intertwined with the lush landscape with our own small patio. The beds were super comfortable with great linens and feather comforters and our own fireplace. (We did not try to use it as the weather was not that cold.) Every morning we had a scrumptious breakfast in the morning lit breafast room which featured various fruits, cereals and breads. If you are planning a trip to the wine country, you must seriously consider choosing the La Residence Country Inn. It's simply a wonderful nothern California experience and close to all the spectacular wineries as well!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MsDeb50
Reviews.Content: Great room with huge bath and walk in shower. Lovely grounds with pool. We stayed two nights and hated to leave. Wish the breakfasts had some variance, but the buffet was ok. Lovely to eat outside in the morning and liked that you could eat early or late. The staff was helpful and professional. It was quiet even with the busy highway nearby. Great location to get to all the wineries. Intimacy of a B&B with the service and privacy of a good inn.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Amongst the Vineyards”
Reviews.Author: Mentor189
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Napa was enhanced by having chosen La Residence as the base for our explorations. Convenient to everything and far enough away from the 'maddening crowd'. We stayed in one of the cottages just so we could spread out and had our own private sitting area overlooking the vineyard. Very pleasant. Wine and cheese each night at the main building and excellent continental breakfasts each morning. Everything was well-appointed in the cottage and it was an easy walk to the main building for breakfasts and afternoon wine and cheese. Staff was very helpful with planning the days for tastings and nights for restaurants. Highly recommended if you are heading to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with a capital "C"”
Reviews.Author: k_and_g_from_seattle
Reviews.Content: La Residence is a truly charming place. Beautiful grounds and beautiful rooms. The staff were exceptionally friendly and provided very helpful tips that only true locals can provide. Nice continental breakfast and evening wine hour. This place attracts interesting people and was easy to strike up lively discussions at the wine hour with other guests. Nice pool and hot tub. No spa. This place is great for couples. Not so much for families or traditional business traveler. Bonus: Bistro Don Giovanni is in easy walking distance from La Residence. Great food and wine list and no need to drive afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: yblain
Reviews.Content: They must be so sick & tired of reading this, but this hotel would be perfect if it weren't so close to Highway 29 - and therefore just too noisy. Beautiful gardens - sitting right on the winery - large rooms, beautifully decorated, a quaint, comfortable setup, excellent breakfast and end-of-day tastings. Great location (winery-wise, at least), it's within minutes of the region's best wine makers. But it IS a little noisy (albeit not bad in the rooms with windows shut), there's no escaping that sad fact.

Reviews.Title: “Been recommending to all our friends”
Reviews.Author: SLearn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were instantly impressed with the staff right off the get go. Friendly and courteous without fault. This was the case for our entire stay. The room was great and the location is perfect. We had just been in the Wharf area for three days before this and disappointed with our accommodations. La Residence restored our faith in value and service. It feels like a B&B, but works like a Hotel. The best of both with no downsides. There is a restaurant just down the road that is fantastic and a taxi ride into town for other restaurants is easily obtained and recommended. It is Napa after all, so no designated drivers for us. The staff arranged everything, had great recommendation on food, wineries and tours to enjoy. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and property”
Reviews.Author: CtShoreline
Reviews.Content: Mansion house was wonderful with large suite and private hot tub in the backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in the heart of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: charles6346
Reviews.Content: We learned that La Residence is owned by Craig and Catherine Hall. We are members of the Hall Wine Club and we recieved a discount on the roomrate. The Hotel was a very good choice for us. The Hotel is conviently located right along Highway 29. The grounds are lovely. There is a pool and hot tub. We had a nice room on the first floor of the "mansion". There is some road noise but it did not disturb our sleep. The breakfeast is very good and the happy hour wine and cheese service is outstanding. They will serve Hall wines if requested. The first night we walked to the Bistro Don Giovanni for dinner. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we would stay here again when we visit the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: cartierkid
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay.All the staff very helpful and friendly . A very relaxing place to be with many exciting vineyards and places to visit all around. Excellent location. Maybe could do with a larger Howard Lane road sign,the current is difficult to spot traveling south.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Serene in Napa”
Reviews.Author: JacqB
Reviews.Content: Stunning grounds with small vineyards planted for a feeling of being surrounded by the vine. Breakfasts were really nice in a quaint dining room or out on the patio, as was afternoon wine tasting. The room was nice, small, b&b style, but very clean. Didn't love being on the first floor, as other residents could walk past the many windows which forced us to keep it all locked up, whether we were there or not. All in all a charming property. A bit frustrating at the end, had to wait a long time for the concierge to help other guests when I just wanted to hand in my key...not the best ending to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “La Residence Was My Partner In Making My Proposal Special!”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaALeonard
Reviews.Content: I wanted to propose to my girlfriend in Wine Country, which is where our relationship began six years earlier. In order to avoid suspicion, I decided to propose as part of an anniversary trip we planned to Napa. We chose the La Residence Inn to stay for the first (and my girlfriend thought only) night of our trip. I then called them up and asked to make a second night's reservation in my name to surprise her after I proposed with another day in beautiful Napa. When I called to make the secret reservation, La Residence upgraded us to a suite for free and said they would have champagne ready in the room when they learned that I planned to propose after "checking out" on the second day of our trip. I really cannot praise the staff of this inn enough. They kept the secret, helped me make last minute reservations for dinner after I proposed, had the champagne perfectly chilled for out return, and brought us a full plate of wine and cheese when we got back to the inn to bask in the big change in our relationship. More than anything, I think my fiance and I both most appreciated their genuine excitement for our engagement. Beyond all of this, the place is fantastic - charming, quaint, relaxing, and clean. We will always be grateful for the role this place played in our special day. Thanks La Residence!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure in Wine Country.... Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Travelersinthebiz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at La Residence several times in the last few years and have had nothing but fantastic experiences.... of special note are the staff (especially Alana and Graham) who were always willing and wanting to go above and beyond. When we started looking for a special place for our wedding party and family to stay, we contacted La Residence and what they did for us was amazing.... We ending up buying out the entire inn and they could not have been nicer. They truly made it feel like it was "our home"... from special meals to always being there for us (even late into the evening)... Summary: A truly wonderful hidden treasure in wine country, staffed by amazing people, and a perfect fit for the romantic weekend all the way to a family reunion / wedding / gathering.

Reviews.Title: “Great, secluded location in Napa”
Reviews.Author: kimjim
Reviews.Content: La Residence is a larger inn that is just off of the main highway. There is one restaurant within walking distance and Yountville with the many outstanding restaurants is about a 10-minute drive from the inn. The Inn is owned by the Hall family, who produce execellent wines. The weekend rates can sometimes be high (over $300 or $400), but because of its location, this seems to be the going rate in the area. There is a free wine and cheese happy hour at 6p and breakfast is included. The breakfast consists of pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, juices, hot coffee and tea. There is no hot breakfast. The bed is very comfortable and the room is large. All rooms seem to have a fireplace, large bathrooms, and sitting areas either inside and/or outside. There is free wireless Internet service if you ask for the code. The staff is friendly, but for the most part, leave you alone. There is a small pool in the middle of the property and a hot tub hidden in the back of the property. This place is probably better for adults than families with younger children.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and gorgeous stay in La Residence”
Reviews.Author: SteffiFan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Vegas, which was a fabulous moment in our life. We then hired a car and drove to Los Angeles and then up the West Coast. It was fantastic but a bit hectic as we stopped by just for a couple of days in LA, one night in Santa Barbara, one night in Carmel, 2 nights in San Fransisco - we were pretty tired and were longing for a place to relax, read a book, eat well and drink some good wine! We were also looking forward to get some sun as it was pretty chilly in San Fransisco and for anybody who is looking to discover the West Coast by Road 1, I wouldn't advise to travel in June as it is pretty foggy all the way! (we were expecting a lovely weather in Santa Barbara and instead it was very cloudy and a bit cold... during this period of time the sun only shines between 6pm and 8pm ( not joking). Their summer really starts in August up to October. So, we drove from SF to Napa Valley which took a good hour and we arrive in this dreamland - sunshine and fantastic views over millions of vineyards, pretty amazing. La Residence was exactly what we needed, a very pieceful place with fountains, swimming pool, jacuzzi, lovely terrace for breakfast, wine and cheese tasting every day. It was amazing and we highly recommend it to everyone wanting to visit Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy (next to highway) and room smelled very bad!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi49Brunxwick
Reviews.Content: Setting was very, very nice, as was the staff, but the road noise and the really pungent odor in our room (urine?) ruined our experience. We awoke during the night due to the smell and opened a window but had to close it again immediately because it had no screen. We informed the front desk when we checked out in the morning and were told...sorry...and that was that! So....as much as we loved the ambiance of the place, we wouldn't stay there again. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Fun day in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Mike7161
Reviews.Content: Traveling through Napa Valley and was suggested to try this place. In all my trips to the area for wine tasting, I had never stayed here. What a gem, great location; a little oasis on two acres with the mountains and vineyards and the gardens made for a relaxing peaceful stay. We stayed in the main building on the second floor with a deck over looking the grounds. Breakfast was nice and a good way to start the day. Staff were all pleasant and helpful really seemed to want to help. Will add to my list of must visit again. Hope they have rooms in the fall - should be very pretty. Thanks for the relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, cozy, victornian Napa getaway...we'll surely be back again soon.”
Reviews.Author: goinup2
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience during our stay at La Residence, The property is tucked away in a beautifully wooded garden area with gorgeous flower beds, plants and water fountains. The grounds are perfectly manicured and clean. It is perfectly located within minutes of the Napa Valley wine country and the vineyards. The staff, managed by Graham Yallop, was as downhome friendly and helpful as you can get. They went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The concierge, Kimberly Lund made the recommendations and the reservations for all of our wine tasting tours at the vineyards as well as the restaurants we dined at each evening. Outstanding selections. Each tour and restaurant was top shelf. The building we stayed in at La Residence was a beautifully rennovated and antique furnished vineyard mansion built in the late 1800's. We can't say enough about how great our stay was and how well were treated. It was like we were among old friends. We absolutely would not stay anywhere else when we come back again to the Napa Valley wine country. Bill and Karen, Littleton, CO

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: kendorgay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at la Residence early May 2011, the property has excellent staff, and great service,we loved the fact that the rooms are well appointed with great beds and bathroom products, we also love the location, which was very convenient to get around the valley. we enjoyed the wine hour , and Breakfast also. we look forward to going back soon

Reviews.Title: “Our new Napa Retreat”
Reviews.Author: mpdeps
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at La Residence several times, by ourselves and with a group of friends and we just had to comment on our new favorite Napa retreat. What a wonderful hidden gem right on the main drag at the gateway to the valley. Just minutes from all that the valley has to offer. From arrival to checkout everything was perfect. The staff, the grounds, the rooms, the service, all were above our expectaions. Even a vinyard in the middle of the property. They will help with every detail of your stay, you just have to ask. Some of the best sleep that we have ever had. The patio is a great place to meet and greet fellow travelers while you enjoy the wine casual wine hour. Check it out; you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expected more”
Reviews.Author: AisleSeatPlease
Reviews.Content: For the most part, we enjoyed our stay at La Residence, but it lacked the "wow" factor I was hoping for and the "luxury" that their website describes. At the price I was paying, I expected more. Likes: - Grounds: The best part of the Inn. Lots of little gardens and sitting places to read a book or sip a glass of wine. - Location: Easy access on Rt. 29 with wineries and restaurants all within an easy drive. - There is a nice pool, but it wasn't heated and we found the water too cold when we would come back around 6pm and therefore didn't use it. If you took a day off from touring, this would be a nice respite. We did use the hot tob and this was great! We found the wine hour was a great time to use the hot tub. All the other guests were there and we got the tub to ourselves after a day of touring. - Nice evening wine reception with plenty of tasty treats. - Nice breakfasts with fruit salad, pastries and your choice of 2 main dishes. A nice way to start your day of touring. Although, each day we were there, both choices were a form of eggs. It would be nice to have another option. - All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Dislikes: - Our room was in the Mansion house. While it was quaint, comfortable and clean, I wouldn't say it was "luxurious" by any means. The decor, furnishings and linens were nothing special. At this price point, I expected a luxury spa and we got a country inn. I'm sure other rooms were nicer, but they came way over our budget. - Noise: Our room was on the first level and unfortunately both right within the main door and at the bottom of a staircase, making for some foot-traffic noise. There is also the noise from the highway out front. Furthermore, there were chairs on the front porch outside our windows and other guests would occassionally sit there and chat. No fault of the Inn, just oblivious tourists who can't think beyond themselves. We were only there 2 nights, but I would have requested a room change if staying longer. - The hot water took a while to heat up, but when it finally kicked in, it was scalding. We also didn't like that our room had the sink located in the bedroom area, outside of the bathroom. I would stay here again if I somehow got a special rate, but otherwise would save the money and spend it on a nice dinner or other aspects of the trip. In the end, we spent very little time at the hotel and most of our time out touring and tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: KLDSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at La Residence, and we cannot wait to go back. The rooms are fabulous, large, nicely decorated, super clean. The property is gorgeous, grapevines right out side our room, with lovely chairs and a table, you can view the stars at night and enjoy a glass of wine..... Very quiet...........very cozy......... The evening wine and appetizers are a great way to start off the evening on the main patio. Breakfast was equally tasty, and a great way to start the day..........

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice rooms, nice folks”
Reviews.Author: bmeeder
Reviews.Content: We're from Dallas and my wife's hair stylist recommended La Residence. So you never know where a good recommendation might come from! Located one block off Hwy. 29, where many of the more popular winery tasting rooms and tours are located. Most of the rest are probably within a 20-minute drive. It's lovely and quaint, but not as frilly and "frew frew" (is that a word?) as some of the B&Bs. The main building is like a large home, with outside access to the rooms. Plus a few smaller "homes" on the property. We stayed in Suite 13, which has a bedroom, sitting room and two bathrooms. Very nice. Our adult son slept on the pull-out sofa and it was pretty darn uncomfortable. But everything else was wonderful. Big, poofy bed with nice linens. Very modern bath area. The largest, fluffiest towels I've ever seen in a hotel were an unexpected amenity. The office has a friendly, helpful staff. (Got us a discount on a hot-air balloon ride...which, if you've never done before is absolutely worth getting picked-up at 5:15 a.m. to experience.) Continental breakfast included omelets. I believe the property is now owned by the Hall winery, so they have tastings every evening in the large dining room. Large, outside deck with comfy seating for relaxing and chatting with guests in the evening. Very nice Italian restaurant within walking distance that Robert Mondavi used to visit. We would definitely stay here again. (If you're visiting several vinyards, try Robert Mondavi for an excellent tour and explanation of the winemaking process, but include Viader (pronounced Via-dare) part-way up a mountain for the most spectacular view in the valley as you taste several varietals on their lovely patio (by appointment).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Ron1006
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in paradise. The pre-arrival assistance offered by Tiffany was great and most helpful. The inn was a wonderful oasis after each full day of wine tasting and exploring. Great location just outside the "urban sprawl" of Napa, yet easy drive for dinners in Napa and Yountville. Beautiful grounds and exceptionally well maintained rooms. The evening wine hour and the bountiful breakfast were very nice treats.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and Gardens with nice wine tasting experience at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: mesratings
Reviews.Content: I would come back again. I was to go to the Hilton but we found that this place had more character and was more romating (I have nothing against the Hilton). People are friendly, the wine tasting was free and served with nice appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to relax! Will impress even hard to please clients.”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_Rob
Reviews.Content: I am certainly glad we found La Residence. We were looking for a place to have a business meeting and vacation for a small group of 15-20 upper management professionals and clients. After calling around Napa to several of the high end resorts a friend suggested La Residence. I must admit… I was a little hesitant to book a boutique hotel with our clients so I checked with the visitors bureau in Napa and it came highly recommended. The hotel is hidden away just off Hwy 29 in Napa Valley and it is absolutely one of Napa’s undiscovered gems. The surroundings are quaint country home with a touch of decadence. The photo’s on their website just don’t do it justice, it is very nice. They offer a full breakfast each morning with fresh coffee, orange juice, an array of fresh fruits and a wonderful three course breakfast. When we finished breakfast we found our meeting room properly setup and ready to go. The hotel provides free wifi throughout the property and it works well so you’re always close enough to the office if you need to be. There is a very nice pool and large hot tub on property for cooling off and relaxing and they are clean and well taken care of. The grounds are well kept and picturesque. The rooms are well maintained and the beds are very comfortable. I slept better at the La Residence than I do in my own bed. After our meetings and a full day out and about in Napa we returned to find our rooms clean and tidy. At 6:00pm we met for their daily complementary wine and cheese hour and found an exquisite selection of cheeses as well as different hot delicacies each day. It was a very relaxing way to wind up the day before heading out to Napa for dinner. Our week long experience there was nothing less than exceptional. From the moment we checked in we felt relaxed and at home. They have a very nice meeting space and they provided us with the technology we needed to hold our meeting as well as food and beverage services. The food and esthetic presentation were first rate. I was very impressed by this unique boutique hotel; we couldn’t have asked for more. Everyone at the hotel was absolutely delightful and accommodating to our every need. They provided us with the personal service and a level of professionalism you don’t find in your garden variety hotel chain or even in many high end hotels. We found it to be an exceptional value for the quality of room and service you get. Thanks La Residence, we’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, value, and great food as part of the room. Nice!”
Reviews.Author: CATravelWest
Reviews.Content: Mr. & Mrs. Hall have a winner here. The service staff is excellent. Clean and comfortable rooms, great bed, convenient location, and the hot breakfast as well as the evening wine & cheese event are a great bonus. The staff is excellent and Alana Willson in Sales went the extra mile for everyone. The location, albeit nesteled just off Hwy 29 gives the feel of a country estate. I enjoyed the complimentary wine and bottled water placed in the room. Thanks all for a great place, a great value, and making everyone feel "at home."

Reviews.Title: “wish I could say I like it but......”
Reviews.Author: gerronimo
Reviews.Content: I wish I couls say I like it here. The property is beautiful, semi-well located, and the staff was great. Morning breakfasts and evening wine tasting were great!! But...it's all about the room. The main problem is that the front door to your room is also the window and it is on a corridor whch serves other rooms. So, when you are in your room and want privacy, you must close the drapes and turn on the lights. And the way this is et up, the drapes are closed all the time, day and night if you don't want your neighbors to see EVERYTHING going on in your room. Other problems that bugged me: the sink drained slowly, the bathtub drain is a popup and a toe breaker, and the internet was intermittent.. The decor is beautiful, the bathroom is cleverly appointed, but the privacy issue is a major problem. Could have been in a wine cave instead.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service that rivals the best Napa Valley wine”
Reviews.Author: freqhotelguest2
Reviews.Content: At La Residence they make the extra effort to make your stay in the Valley an experience to remember. As an experienced traveler, La Residence has hit the mark with comfortable beds and fireplaces in the room to make for a rejuvanating stay. However it is the extra's that put La Residence into the repeat stay category and recommend to friends category. What are those extra's? An incredible breakfast (included in the price of the stay) and a nightly wine and cheese experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel with nice extras”
Reviews.Author: MAKM09
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel with little extras that made the stay nice. Wine and cheese reception, complimentary hot breakfast, pool, fireplace in the room, restaurant within walking distance, sitting area, balcony's off of every room, free parking, music CD's in the room....I even saw DVD rentals in the office! The staff was very nice and provided an escort to the room. We reserved one of the small rooms in the main building and I expected the room to be very small...but I was pleasantly surprised with the how spacious the room was. The only down side is that is not all that close to the wineries. It is about a 10 minute drive to St. Helena (where many of the wineries are) and a 10 minute drive to down town Napa....but great for a romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing escape to wine country”
Reviews.Author: susaneb
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 4 nights at La Residence, especially the last two where we switched to a 2nd floor room with a balcony in the main building. The rooms were pleasant and fairly spacious. The breakfasts were tasty and nicely served. The wine hour was an especially nice surprise on the day of our arrival, following some GPS mishaps along the way. The wine hour also provided an opportunity to mingle with other guests and get ideas on things to do and wineries to visit.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: CLane1
Reviews.Content: Hi my husband and I wanted to stay close to restaurants and wineries this was the best wxperience ever. It exceeded our expectations!! The staff was wonderful, very helpful. Our room was cozy and romantic. Thank you to all the staff and the Hall family for making our anniversary so memorable. We love you!! The Lanes

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn !”
Reviews.Author: golfcrzy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Napa on 5/26/09. Each year we go with another couple over Memorial day weekend. I choose La Residence because of tripadvisor. The room was large, clean and very Modern. For breakfast you have two choices on the menu, different each day. Great coffee and fresh fruit also. In the evening they have Hall wines (Because that is who owns the Inn) with snacks. The outdoor seating, Hot Tub and over all feeling of this Inn was WONDERFUL. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “barely charming and they fleeced us”
Reviews.Author: katiezzzzzz
Reviews.Content: Don't, under any circumstances, pay for their "worry free wine tasting package." Over the phone they told us they would book our tastings and a car for the day. The car was an hour late, the limo air conditioning was broken on a 100 degree day, and the hotel had only booked one tasting. The rest of the day was up to us....and we had to ride around in an awful limo with no a/c.....we felt like we were trapped in a hairdryer. The hotel is pleasant enough. Small rooms that need updating, but decent. If you are a clean freak, then you should know there were a bunch of someone else's hair in the shower when we checked in--ewww. No room service, no on demand tv etc, but the hotel itself is so-so--certainly not luxury in the least. They did end up crediting us a small amount for the "worry free wine tasting" fiasco, but then put a $50 charge on my card so they could mail back my phone charger I forgot. They promised to refund the approx. $45 out of the $50 they took out of my account. I wouldn't stay there again--it's far overpriced and I felt the $50 charge for sending me back my phone charger was over the top. They are out to make $$. Staff is nice, but I wouldn't recommend to anyone nor stay there again. And...it was our first anniversary and the first time we had left our sweet 9 week old baby with grandma-so I expected perfection-and was sorely let down. All that for $1000 for two days-go somewhere else folks.

Reviews.Title: “Good B&B”
Reviews.Author: PD2K
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a charming B&B for our stay in Napa - it was my wife's birthday. We were recommended the La Residence Inn. It is a good B&B and service is what you expect. Location is good - just off Hwy 29 next to Bistro Don Giovanni. The room was well appointed (albeit small) with comfortable bed and nice linens. Bathroom is small and had Molton Brown toiletries. The TV's (small flat screen) reception was not so good. The breakfast room had juice and pastries - ok decor. I recommend the attached outdoor patio to have your breakfast. The breakfast was good, but very weak coffee. La Residence has a daily wine tasting which you can sample Hall's wines - we never attended because we were always out in the vineyards. We tried using the outdoor jacuzzi, but it did not work (the attendant tried to start it many times). All in all we liked the inn and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique B&B in Napa- but needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: mikichan
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at La Residence for Thanksgiving. We continue to love this B&B hotel. But we cannot give them 5 stars- here are some of our observations. 1) the rooms are too small for $259 / night before tax. A price of $210 would be already plenty. 2) The beds are designated as queen size, but to us they felt kind of tiny. 3) Pillows were stuffy, cheap and uncomfortable. 4) Mattresses were not firm enough; after 7 hours of sleep, I woke up with some back pain; guess I am used to an expensive orthopedic mattress at home, and your mattress wasn't like that. If my spouse moved during the night, I almost got ejected out of the bed. A spring mattress in 2008? Please replace, urgently! We went to a Hilton in SF immediately after La Residence, and we were amazed how much better their beds were, and the pillows were amazing compared to yours! The Hilton hotel in Chinatown was just a fraction of the price. 5) In 2007, your hotel offered a complementary set of firewood to guests. Additional set were available for a small charge. This year, there was no firewood... What do we do with an empty fireplace? Maybe due to the economy you're cutting costs, but for $259 per night before taxes, I'd say this was a great touch and we really missed it. On the positive side, we like the CD / radio player + flat screen TV with DVD player in the rooms, and your stylish bathrooms. The breakfast & the happy hour with wine tasting at 6:00 PM are just outstanding. All in all the hotel is still great, but we insist you should fix the items we listed. Best of luck with your business.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING B&B in Napa!!!!”
Reviews.Author: S80
Reviews.Content: From the minute I called to book our stay here I knew La Residence was going to be fantastic. James and Lori couldn't have been more helpful and were extremely knowledgeable about the local wineries and restaurants and made excellent recommendations. We stayed for 2 nights the end of July, we were there with another couple and my husband and myself. The property itself is tucked away right off Rt 29 and is very quaint...it has a few buildings on property which house the hotel rooms, a great pool, jacuzzi and vineyards. Its just beautiful! We stayed in the main building on the upper level...our room was amazing. The beds were very comfortable and the room was spacious and decorated immaculately. The bathrooms are also large and very modern. La Residence serves breakfast every day, and its not a continental breakfast -- we had a choice of 3 entrees every day and they varied from Eggs Benedict to Banana Bread French Toast, to Vegetable Omelets among others. There were 4 of us staying there and everyone loved their respective breakfasts. Regarding proximity to the sights, we were never more than a 10-20 minute drive to anywhere we wanted to go. I would highly recommend this hotel, we had just a wonderful time here!

Reviews.Title: “So much potential, but...”
Reviews.Author: allison1973
Reviews.Content: La Residence is a charming property from the exterior with a fabulous staff, but the rooms are severely lacking the luxury qualties advertised. We stayed for three nights in a Junior Suite in the Old Mansion. The room was extremely stuffy during the night making it impossible to sleep. The bathroom drawer fell out onto the floor when opened. The window coverings in the bathroom weren't quite adequate. Anyone could walk on to the back balcony and see you showering or using the toilet. When you turned the wall-mounted reading lamps on, they fell over hanging upside down on the wall. The armoire wouldn't stay closed. The water in the shower would suddenly become burning hot lasting for several minutes. The "sumptous" chairs in the sitting area were so old the cushions were completely flat and the carpet appears to date back to the 1980s. The hotel has great potential. It needs a lot of TLC and some updating before it can claim luxury status. With such a great staff and the beautiful property, It really wouldn't take much to get this B&B to be a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Night Sleep Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: travelingod
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my 30th birthday celebration and it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel staff was very helpful and accommadating. The grounds of the hotel were very beautful and the beds were the most comfortable out of any hotel/resort I have stayed at. My husband and I came home wanting to buy a new bed ASAP. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a quiet, romantic getaway. The Italian restaurant next door is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Will return again!”
Reviews.Author: lollymissy
Reviews.Content: We booked this inn based on the review and photos. We spent two nights in just a king room for our honeymoon (spending about 250 per night on a weekday), which were beyond our expectations. The bed was very comfortable with many pillows and a down comforter. Their continental breakfast is wonderful and yummie with a choice of 2 items, fruit, and pastries. They also have a wine and cheese hour which highlights their own wine. The staff was attentive and pleasant. Will return again for another trip to napa.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at La Residence”
Reviews.Author: nathindubai
Reviews.Content: Following a rather hectic vacation, having spent time in Las Vegas and San Francisco, we finished off with two nights at La Residence. Following an easy 90min drive from San Francisco, we found the hotel easily on the north side of Napa. On driving in to the property we were immediately impressed with the attention to detail given to the gardens and hotels buildings. We were met at reception by Edric, who quickly carried out the required check-in formalities and arranged for us to be shown to our room. Our room was situated on the upper level of the main building, accessible via stairs to the side of the property. There are a number of seating areas scattered around the property, allowing you to take in the gardens and the small number of vines growing in the grounds of the hotel. Our room was pink. Now pink is not something we would normally find a pleasant environment, however it worked. The room was a good size, with an incredibly comfortable bed. The proportions of the bedroom and the bathroom were perfect. Not too big, and not too small.... Just right! During our two night stay, we had the breakfast included each morning, and I have to say it was excellent. Scrambled Egg with pesto shrimp was just what the doctor ordered, and the next morning was just as nice, although I am struggling to remember exactly what was served. We also took full advantage of the evening wine tasting. This hotel is owned by Hall Wines, and each evening a selection of their wines are available for tasting, accompanied with a selection of hor'dourves. This is a great time to meet some of your fellow travelers, and share experiences of wineries visited in the Napa Valley. Previous posts have mentioned the traffic noise. Yes, this property is located close to the highway, but to be honest it had no bearing on our thoroughly enjoyable stay at La Residence. As and when we have the opportunity to return to Napa, La Residence will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anners49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Residence in Napa Valley on a Sat/Sun night in late August 2007. We got super lucky - we booked the room only a few days in advance and got a king room (not a suite). Cost was $425/$325 per night respectively. I would absolutely recommend this inn & plan to stay there again. The location is good, not in the middle of the craziness, but not too far away. Someone said that they were bothered by the road noise -- I didn't hear it at all. Honestly, it was not an issue in any way. Breakfast was included in our rate & it was great both days; pancakes w/ bacon & eggs with shrimp (they were great about substitutions also). Plus it goes till 10 so you don't have to get up too early if you don't want to. The room was clean & you got a free bottle of wine. Bed was comfy, towels & robes were fluffy. Felt like a B&B but since there are a few buildings it was more private (I think 40 rooms total). Parking was easy & it's not hard to get there from the road. The hot tub was great - big, clean & not too hot or cold. The pool looked a tad dirty - this was my only problem & since I wasn't dying to go in, it was no biggie. Best of all was their complimentary wine hour from 6-7 - good appetizers & great wine generously poured. Very romantic & worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Best - What More Could You Possibly Ask For”
Reviews.Author: Cabernet23
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 28-31, my wife and I just got back to the "real" world. Felt obligated to sit down and write the world to let them know what an excellent stay we had at La Residence in Napa - Edric and Alex were just awesome - very helpful and always looking to make your stay better. The morning breakfast was five star quality prepared fresh by world famous chef. The coffee was fresh grind every morning (how many resorts can attest to that) and the food was excellent. The newly owned resort (by Hall Family and Winery) appears to have been a huge plus and upgrade! The nightly wine hour was excellent serving of course Hall Wine with an assortment of fine cheeses, breads, olives, meats, and fresh fruit. The room was always very neat and well prepared. Ours had a distress pine desk and a poster bed with a large pine entertainment center with tons of storage. Nice wet bar with refrigerator also accompanied the room filled with cold waters and sodas. Huge bathroom. You really have the best of both worlds staying at the La Residence........you have the comforts, convenience and friendly personal service of a B&B style Inn but also have the luxury and upgrades of a 5 star hotel. Also, the refreshing pool and spa were very inviting and great to come home to after a full day of wine tasting - it was a good sobering experience if you know what I mean after a full day of tasting. Can't wait to go back. Great memories remain. Did not get a chance to tour Hall Wineries due to lack of time but definitely will next trip. Excellent location as well, 5 or 6 quality wineries all within a 5-6 minute drive of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: markfromboston
Reviews.Content: This Inn is fantastic. This was our 3rd trip to Napa & the Inn was the best place we stayed so far. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are very nice (comfy beds!) but the best part about this Inn is that the staff makes you feel very welcome. Breakfast is very nice but the wine hour is great. We ate so much food at the wine hour that we didn't go to dinner. The Inn is owned by the Hall winery and you receive a free full bottle of wine in your room when you check in. The rooms are a bit more expensive than some hotels but once you factor in the free breakfast, wine & food in the evening and the free bottle of wine, you've recapped some of that cost. The hot tub is well landscaped and private, there are plenty of seating areas around the property and the patio furniture is top notch (think Pottery Barn). The pool temp is a bit cold the the pool area is small but we spent most of out time in the hot tub. The crowd did seem to be older (think 50's) and my wife and I are in our 30's but that was OK. Also, be sure to eat at the Italian place down the room. We had a great dinner (not too expensive) and brought our free bottle of Hall wine ($20 corkage fee), best of all, after drinking the bottle of wine, we only had to walk a block to be back at our hotel room. Trip advisor gives the Inn only 3 stars but this is at least a 4 star property. My only concern was why no AAA discount?

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else when in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Napa_Neubie
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay through Expedia and found the reviews here to be a bit alarming. Either they loved it or hated it. After experiencing our stay we are baffled why ANYONE could have ANYHING negative to say about this FABULOUS place. The grounds are meticulously manicured, the rooms are far superior to the stays we've had at more "upper end" resorts but the real jewel here is the service. From the moment we arrived until the time we left we were treated as if we were the only guests staying there. Every request or need was met with a smile and prompt, curteous compliance. After the fact we were asked if it was up to our expectations and in every case, the service FAR exceeded our expectations. Have a request? Need reservations? Ask the front desk and if it's evenly slightly possible it will be taken care of cheerfully and promptly by the staff on duty. This was our first trip to Napa and while there are other places that looked intriging to try next time there's nothing that would cause us to vary from this "bird in the hand" we discovered in Napa. The property was recently purchased by the Hall family of the Hall winery. Breakfast is complimentary and NOT continental but always something gourmet and delicious. 6PM comes the complimentary wine and hors derves (sp?) that are on par with any resort one could pay for. The wine is a selection of one of the Hall family's most current offering and on all 3 days we were there it was exquisite. I hesitate to write this gleaming review of this property as I'm afraid it might cause our little known jewel to become a popular destination for all travelers to Napa however, I feel that the extraordinary experience we had deserves the accolades I'm writing here. If you're in Napa and looking for a GREAT lodging experience, DON'T miss La Residence....We certainly won't!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Crunchy47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Napa to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. We stayed at LaResidence. It was such a disappointment. They didn't acknowledge our special date. The food was not good. The pool was extremely dirty and the room was dark and undesirable. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: WINEGURU
Reviews.Content: This amazing and georgous hotel is not to be missed by anyone. From the moment you arrive with the beautiful grounds to the minute you enter your room, you will feel as if you have reached heaven. This very charming property is well kept and in perfect condition. From the rooms to the great morning breakfast, it is the perfect spot for anyone. The wine and cheese hour is delightful while sitting outside looking at the vines and georgous fountains. James the GM is nothing but class. He took care of our every need and even booked us on a great wine tour. I can only say that I cannot wait to check in again!

HotelInfo.Name: La Residence
HotelInfo.Address: 4066 Howard Lane, Napa, CA 94558
